feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: Operationally, "daily wage calculator" is used to compute daily-rate based salary amounts (e.g., deductions, proration, or settlement-related calculations) based on configuration and payroll/leave context. Ticket evidence repeatedly connects this behaviour to unpaid leave deductions and leave-related payroll adjustments. Evidence indicates calculations may use either calendar days or working days (with weekends/holidays considerations) depending on configuration and scenario. Tickets highlight configuration precedence where global payroll settings can override policy-level settings, creating unexpected outcomes for users. Tickets also report UI/display mismatches (e.g., remarks showing different day counts) even when backend calculations are otherwise consistent. Several tickets suggest recalculation/synchronization gaps where changes (salary config, holidays, deleted requests) do not retroactively update already-generated results. Customer requests frequently ask for greater configurability, clearer transparency, and control over calculation bases and divisors.

known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Daily Wage Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system lacks automated salary calculation based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: Significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation exists.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Formula Between Leave Policy and Payroll Settings
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows a discrepancy in daily wage formula calculation between leave policy and payroll settings for unpaid leave. The payroll-side daily wage calculator takes precedence and overrides the leave policy formula, which is displayed as greyed out.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage formula in leave policy can be overridden by payroll settings configuration
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll deduction discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculator Leap Year Miscalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator incorrectly handles leap years by defaulting to 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate service period calculation and lower gratuity amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: System does not dynamically adjust for leap years in service period calculations
known_issues.gap_statement: The EOS gratuity calculator lacks leap year recognition, causing potential underpayment of employee benefits

known_issues.title: Incorrect Pro-Rated End of Service Amount Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals (e.g., showing 89,999.9 instead of 9000).
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
known_issues.issue_explanation: System gratuity calculation showed slight difference from manual calculations. Calculation involves splitting service duration into different periods with varying daily rates (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year afterward), with prorated calculations for incomplete years.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Gratuity calculation requires complex service duration splitting and prorated daily wage calculations
known_issues.gap_statement: Potential complexity in handling precise gratuity calculations for employees with non-standard service durations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The difference was observed between 912 and 913 total days, impacting the final calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Methodology Nuances
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator has a complex gratuity calculation methodology that differs from manual expectations, specifically in handling partial years above 5 years of service and leap year day counting. The system calculates service duration with nuanced logic that may not be immediately transparent to users.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic is intricate and not transparently communicated, leading to potential misunderstandings about how partial years and leap years are processed.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic, including worked examples of service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Discrepancy in Days Worked Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing gratuity, potentially adding an extra day to the total job tenure calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked counting logic

known_issues.title: Fixed Daily Wage Calculation Approach
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform uses a hardcoded daily wage calculation of (Basic Salary / 30), which differs from client's preferred method of (Basic Salary × 12 / 365).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses a fixed 30-day divisor
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of flexibility in daily wage computation method prevents customization of gratuity calculations

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The daily wage is divided according to a fixed configuration (potentially 30 days) rather than adapting to actual calendar days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly working days affect daily wage calculations, causing accrual amount variations
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months with different working day counts.

known_issues.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Calculation Divisors
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses different divisors for leave salary and salary proration calculations. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor, while salary proration uses a 30.42-day divisor, causing calculation mismatches.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations are configured independently with different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Salary Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood working days calculation. The system calculates proration based on work week configuration, where all 7 days can be marked as working days, resulting in a full month (31 days) being considered for calculation.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration depends entirely on work week configuration, which may not align with traditional weekend expectations

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When payroll is processed earlier than the departure date, the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Payroll system lacks robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in daily wage calculator's ability to handle dynamic proration scenarios for employees with departure dates differing from payroll processing date

known_issues.title: Duplicate Deductions on Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator experiences data synchronization problems when public holidays are added after leave requests are created. This causes mismatches between Payroll and Time Off module calculations, resulting in incorrect salary deduction amounts.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The system cannot recalculate daily wage deductions retroactively when public holiday configurations change after leave request creation.
known_issues.gap_statement: Requires module communication enhancement to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across system configurations.

known_issues.title: Unpredictable Deduction Calculations
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system uses a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations, potentially causing confusion about calculation methods.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses non-standard 30.42 day divisor
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The platform displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. The backend calculation remains mathematically correct, but the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. While the backend calculation remains accurate, the frontend display creates potential user confusion.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual leave policy settings, potentially calculating unpaid leave deductions using gross salary instead of basic salary as configured.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparency in configuration hierarchy and limited user controls for customizing leave deduction calculations across different work schedules

known_issues.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month of leave.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate display does not reflect the leave occurrence month's rate
known_issues.gap_statement: Need a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at the time of leave request

limitations.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month (365 annual days - 52 weekly offs = 313 working days / 12 months = 26.08 days)
limitations.impact: Requires manual adjustments for variations in employee attendance

limitations.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
limitations.limitation_statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Leave policy formulas become non-editable when overridden by payroll settings

limitations.title: Salary Configuration Dependency in Leave Deduction
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect payroll deductions if salary configuration is not created before or simultaneously with leave request

limitations.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: The system consistently uses 365 days for all years, failing to recognize 366 days in leap years
limitations.impact: Potential undercalculation of service periods and associated benefits

limitations.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
limitations.limitation_statement: System consistently undercalculates pro-rated amounts by small decimal points, affecting the accuracy of final settlements for employees leaving mid-month.
limitations.impact: Financial calculations may be slightly inaccurate, potentially causing discrepancies in employee compensation

limitations.title: Inflexible Monthly Leave Accrual
limitations.limitation_statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, preventing prorated accrual for mid-month departures
limitations.impact: Employees departing mid-month cannot automatically include partial month's leave balance in End of Service settlement

limitations.title: Ambiguity in Service Days Counting Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically regarding departure date inclusion and leap year day handling
limitations.impact: Potential minor variations in gratuity calculations

limitations.title: Leap Year Day Counting Methodology
limitations.limitation_statement: System uses 366 as divisor for leap years when calculating partial year service duration, which can cause slight variations in gratuity calculations compared to manual methods.
limitations.impact: Potential minor discrepancies in gratuity calculations for service periods including leap years

limitations.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Divisor
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified via configuration
limitations.impact: Prevents organizations from using alternative daily wage calculation methods

limitations.title: Fixed Divisor in Leave Salary Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform uses a fixed divisor for daily wage calculations based on policy configuration, which cannot be easily overridden for specific scenarios or month lengths.
limitations.impact: Users cannot modify the daily rate divisor to account for different month lengths or unique leave scenarios

limitations.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Modes
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage can be calculated using two methods: working days (variable monthly rate) or custom days (consistent rate)
limitations.impact: Accrual calculations will vary based on selected configuration method

limitations.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.
limitations.impact: Inconsistent salary calculations across different payroll scenarios

limitations.title: Daily Wage Proration Based on Work Week Configuration
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days
limitations.impact: Proration may differ from traditional calendar day calculations depending on work week setup

limitations.title: Limited Proration Logic Based on Departure Date
limitations.limitation_statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past, not when it's in the future
limitations.impact: Potential incorrect salary calculations for employees with future offboarding dates

limitations.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling
limitations.limitation_statement: The system cannot reliably manage deductions when leave transactions are modified, deleted, or have status changes.
limitations.impact: Users may experience persistent incorrect payroll deductions that require manual intervention to remove.

limitations.title: Time Off and Payroll Module Data Sync Issue
limitations.limitation_statement: Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation, causing data inconsistency when configuration changes occur mid-cycle.
limitations.impact: Prevents accurate retroactive recalculation of daily wage deductions

limitations.title: Custom Days Divisor for Deductions
limitations.limitation_statement: System calculates unpaid leave deductions using 30.42 days divisor instead of calendar days
limitations.impact: Deduction amounts may not exactly match expected monthly salary

limitations.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculations are based on the actual number of calendar days in a month, which varies (e.g., 29 days in February during leap years).
limitations.impact: Requires precise monthly day count for accurate unpaid leave deductions

limitations.title: Global Settings Override Policy-Level Configurations
limitations.limitation_statement: The platform has a global configuration that supersedes individual policy-level settings for unpaid leave calculations
limitations.impact: Users cannot customize leave deduction calculations at the policy level when a global setting exists

limitations.title: Daily Rate Calculation Method
limitations.limitation_statement: Daily rate is calculated as Basic + Allowances / Working Days, excluding public holidays
limitations.impact: Affects unpaid leave deduction calculations across different months

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: Deduction calculated based on outdated salary configuration
troubleshooting_notes.workaround_or_resolution: Delete the existing leave request and recreate it if the deduction has not been processed yet

troubleshooting_notes.likely_cause_or_explanation: System incorrectly calculates service period by using 365 days instead of 366 days for leap years

troubleshooting_notes.symptom: End of Service amounts showing less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals

Deductions were incorrectly calculated based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll deduction discrepancies.

claims_to_validate.title: EOS Gratuity Calculator Leap Year Miscalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The End of Service (EOS) gratuity calculator incorrectly handles leap years by defaulting to 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate service period calculation and lower gratuity amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Pro-Rated End of Service Amount Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals (e.g., showing 89,999.9 instead of 9000).

claims_to_validate.title: EOS Gratuity Calculation Variance
claims_to_validate.statement: System gratuity calculation showed slight difference from manual calculations. Calculation involves splitting service duration into different periods with varying daily rates (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year afterward), with prorated calculations for incomplete years.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Days
claims_to_validate.statement: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle leap year days (February 29th), causing minor discrepancies in total service days and resulting gratuity amount. The difference was observed between 912 and 913 total days, impacting the final calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Gratuity Calculation Methodology Nuances
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator has a complex gratuity calculation methodology that differs from manual expectations, specifically in handling partial years above 5 years of service and leap year day counting. The system calculates service duration with nuanced logic that may not be immediately transparent to users.

claims_to_validate.title: Discrepancy in Days Worked Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Platform calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing gratuity, potentially adding an extra day to the total job tenure calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed Daily Wage Calculation Approach
claims_to_validate.statement: Platform uses a hardcoded daily wage calculation of (Basic Salary / 30), which differs from client's preferred method of (Basic Salary × 12 / 365).

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. The daily wage is divided according to a fixed configuration (potentially 30 days) rather than adapting to actual calendar days.

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Salary Accrual Inconsistency
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Daily Wage Calculation Divisors
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses different divisors for leave salary and salary proration calculations. Leave salary uses a 30-day divisor, while salary proration uses a 30.42-day divisor, causing calculation mismatches.

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Proration Calculation Confusion
claims_to_validate.statement: User initially misunderstood working days calculation. The system calculates proration based on work week configuration, where all 7 days can be marked as working days, resulting in a full month (31 days) being considered for calculation.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
claims_to_validate.statement: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing date. When payroll is processed earlier than the departure date, the system displays the full monthly salary instead of a prorated amount.

claims_to_validate.title: Duplicate Deductions on Leave Recalculation
claims_to_validate.statement: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Error
claims_to_validate.statement: The daily wage calculator experiences data synchronization problems when public holidays are added after leave requests are created. This causes mismatches between Payroll and Time Off module calculations, resulting in incorrect salary deduction amounts.

claims_to_validate.title: Unpredictable Deduction Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: The system uses a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations, potentially causing confusion about calculation methods.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years. The backend calculation remains mathematically correct, but the frontend display creates potential user confusion.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system applies a global daily rate configuration that overrides individual leave policy settings, potentially calculating unpaid leave deductions using gross salary instead of basic salary as configured.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Daily Rate Month Display
claims_to_validate.statement: The system shows the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate does not match the month of leave.

claims_to_validate.title: Fixed 26 Working Days Monthly Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary is based on a standard 26 working days per month (365 annual days - 52 weekly offs = 313 working days / 12 months = 26.08 days)

claims_to_validate.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Formulas
claims_to_validate.statement: Payroll daily wage calculator configuration takes precedence over leave policy formula for unpaid leave calculations

claims_to_validate.title: Salary Configuration Dependency in Leave Deduction
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave deduction calculations are dependent on the timing of salary configuration creation relative to leave request submission.

claims_to_validate.title: Incorrect Leap Year Day Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: The system consistently uses 365 days for all years, failing to recognize 366 days in leap years

claims_to_validate.title: Decimal Precision Limitation in Pro-Rated Calculations
claims_to_validate.statement: System consistently undercalculates pro-rated amounts by small decimal points, affecting the accuracy of final settlements for employees leaving mid-month.

claims_to_validate.title: Inflexible Monthly Leave Accrual
claims_to_validate.statement: Leave days are accrued at end of month, preventing prorated accrual for mid-month departures

claims_to_validate.title: Ambiguity in Service Days Counting Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: Unclear rules for counting service days, specifically regarding departure date inclusion and leap year day handling

claims_to_validate.title: Leap Year Day Counting Methodology
claims_to_validate.statement: System uses 366 as divisor for leap years when calculating partial year service duration, which can cause slight variations in gratuity calculations compared to manual methods.

claims_to_validate.title: Hardcoded Daily Wage Divisor
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage is calculated using a fixed divisor of 30 days (Basic/30), which cannot be modified via configuration

claims_to_validate.title: Leave Encashment Calculation Modes
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage can be calculated using two methods: working days (variable monthly rate) or custom days (consistent rate)

claims_to_validate.title: Separate Daily Wage Calculation Methods
claims_to_validate.statement: The platform calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors.

claims_to_validate.title: Daily Wage Proration Based on Work Week Configuration
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration is calculated based on the specific work week configuration, which may include all 7 days as working days

claims_to_validate.title: Limited Proration Logic Based on Departure Date
claims_to_validate.statement: Salary proration only works correctly when departure date is in the past, not when it's in the future

claims_to_validate.title: Inconsistent Deduction Handling
claims_to_validate.statement: The system cannot reliably manage deductions when leave transactions are modified, deleted, or have status changes.

claims_to_validate.title: Time Off and Payroll Module Data Sync Issue
claims_to_validate.statement: Time Off module does not send complete leave request details to Payroll module at the time of calculation, causing data inconsistency when configuration changes occur mid-cycle.

claims_to_validate.title: Custom Days Divisor for Deductions
claims_to_validate.statement: System calculates unpaid leave deductions using 30.42 days divisor instead of calendar days

claims_to_validate.title: Month-Specific Daily Rate Calculation
claims_to_validate.statement: Daily wage calculations are based on the actual number of calendar days in a month, which varies (e.g., 29 days in February during leap years).
